column1: The shape of the jaws or birth defects such as cleft lip and palate may also be reasons for malocclusion.

Other causes include: - Childhood habits such as thumb sucking, tongue thrusting, pacifier use beyond age 3, and prolonged use of a bottle - Extra teeth, lost teeth, impacted teeth, or abnormally shaped teeth - Ill-fitting dental fillings, crowns, appliances, retainers, or braces - Misalignment of jaw fractures after a severe injury - Tumors of the mouth and jaw There are different categories of malocclusion: - Class 1 malocclusion is the most common.
